item.title: Economic Slack
item.description: This graduate course presents matching models of economic slack and uses them to study business-cycle fluctuations, monetary policy, and fiscal policy.

item.title: Business Cycles and How to Tame Them
item.description: This minicourse describes business cycles, develops a matching model to explain them, and discusses how monetary and fiscal policy can tame them.

item.title: Resolving New Keynesian Anomalies with Wealth in the Utility Function
item.description: This paper resolves the New Keynesian model's anomalies at the zero lower bound by introducing wealth in the utility function. Published in REStat, 2021.

item.title: Optimal Public Expenditure with Inefficient Unemployment
item.description: This paper shows that public expenditure should deviate from the Samuelson rule to reduce the unemployment gap, when it exists. Published in REStud, 2019.

item.title: A Theory of Countercyclical Government Multiplier
item.description: This paper develops a New Keynesian model in which the government multiplier doubles when unemployment rises from 5% to 8%. Published in AEJ Macro, 2014.
